Arrogant boxing champ Kelly Robinson and sensible and not confident special agent compose a great duo, Carlos is a very funny Latin James Bond, and gorgeous Famke Janssen delivers us a Rachel that makes us feel that we may have Xenia Onatopp once more.
After 20 Years this is still one of Eddie Murphy's best Movies made, makes me laugh so hard.

when this film came out 2 summers ago, i was working at my local cinema. although the trailer looked funny, i had a feeling all the good stuff would be in that. how wrong could i be?

eddie murphy and owen Wilson bounce off each other as if they were a comedy double act who've been working together for years. the sexual tension between Wilson and famke janssen is so funny that i nearly split my sides when he compliments her on her stick shifting! never before has a more goofy line made such an impression!

the story may not be up to much but you will laugh your head off all the way through it so it doesn't really matter.

this may not be to most peoples taste's but i believe its a cult classic.

if you want an easy going film with plenty of laughs, watch this film. i guarantee you won't be disappointed. 8.5-10

review_title: NO CULP & COSBY BY A LONG-SHOT!

review_detailed_main: This isn't for everybody, but I've always loved this movie. It's hilarious and one of Eddie Murphy's most underrated movies. It's not an award winning movie but it's a 10 in my book!

review_title: The most boring action film ever made!

review_detailed_main: I thought I Spy was a great movie. Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson have great chemistry. Murphy is hilarious as Kelly Robinson, the undefeated boxing champion. It was very funny- especially the "Marvin Gaye Scene". It also had some good action, but the comedy is still present. I want to see it again. Go out and see it if you need some time to kill. It is a very short film.

review_title: pretty good! I was pleasantly surprised!
review_detailed_main:
I think this was Eddie Murphy's best picture since Beverly Hills Cop. This film will not be winning any Oscars but it was very enjoyable. Eddie and Owen Wilson make a good pair. Eddie's outrageous and over the top character contrasts well with Owen's shy, slightly geeky and mischevious character. There were actually a couple of scenes I thought I was going to bust my gut laughing, and I wasn't the only one. I was in a packed theater and everyone was having a good time.

The movie has action, drama, and funny comedy. It is rather predictable but overall a good evening out.

This movie has EVERYTHING going against it, and yet it prevails. The script is great, the action stays funny instead of trying to get serious. Owen Wilson and Eddie Murphy both do a great job, even if Murphy is basically playing Donkey from Shrek. I saw this at a free preview, and will be sure to see it again when I get the chance.

I laughed so hard my stomach hurt and my eyes watered. To all those saying it's not a good as the the TV series I say "and you're not 15 anymore so get over it!" Did you really expect that duo to artfully reconstitute history? I expected to laugh and was not disappointed

Previews for I Spy made it look like it was gonna be a very lame movie, but I saw it on DVD and couldn't stop laughing! I'm not sure why it got such low reviews; I thought it was great. I guess it all depends on your opinion of what's funny. I give this movie a B+.

review_title: great movie and comradery between Murphy and Wilson
review_detailed_main: I loved this movie. It was great entertainment which is what a movie is really supposed to be. Wilson and Murphy play off eachother wonderfully. There may be some holes and what not, but what movie doesn't when nit picked.

This movie is a must see for anyone who enjoys Eddie Murphy or Owen Wilson. I like Eddie Murphy fine, but Owen Wilson is the one who drew me to the movie. His dry humor has ample time to shine in this film. It was great to see him get a chance to be the "hero" more than the sidekick for a change. If you came looking for a big-screen adaptation of the TV show, or for an intricate plot with great action - well, you came to the wrong place. The plot and action serve only one purpose - they are a background in which Murphy and Wilson can do their thing. I watched the movie only to enjoy the banter between the two of them and I was not disappointed in the least. They work well together - the comic timing, the muttered lines by Wilson, the flashiness of Murphy, all melds to form some great moments. So, it is a must see in my book. It isn't really an action movie - it is a comedy, and in that vein it succeeds. 8 out of 10.

The movie was a great adventure. I love spy gadgets. I even visited a spy shop in queens where I purchased this movie and they sell tons of spy wear. The creative forces behind the show were writers David Friedkin and Morton Fine and cinematographer Fouad Said. Together they formed Triple F Productions under the aegis of Desilu Studios where the show was produced. Fine and Friedkin (who previously wrote scripts for radio's Broadway Is My Beat and Crime Classics under producer/director Elliott Lewis) were co-producers and head writers, and wrote the scripts for 16 episodes, one of which Friedkin directed. Friedkin also dabbled in acting and appeared in two episodes in the first season.

Actor-producer Sheldon Leonard, best known for playing gangster roles in the 1940s and '50s, was the executive producer (receiving top billing before the title in the series' opening title sequence). He also played a gangster-villain role in two episodes and appeared in a third show as himself in a humorous cameo. In addition, he directed one episode and served as occasional second-unit director throughout the series.

I Spy was banned from being shown by certain television stations in the South due to the showcasing of an African-American (Bill Cosby) in a leading role.This movie is great for kids and the family.

review_title: Do you like Murphy and Wilson?
review_detailed_main: Really what it comes down to is whether you like Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson. Personally, I think they're two of the funniest actors out there. Wilson and Murphy play off each other extremely well. Owen Wilson plays his typical role, almost making fun of himself throughout the movie. Eddie Murphy plays an egotistical celebrity. I'm reading a lot of reviews about how their characters get on peoples' nerves. If you have any sense of humor, then they won't, trust me. The only people who don't like this movie are 9 times out of 10 the ones who thought Leave it to Beaver or Maximum Overdrive were good movies. Some of this film's most hilarious moments are when it's making fun of celebrities who are in love with themselves. For example, Eddie Murphy's character refers to himself in the third person constantly. There are so many funny parts in this movie, I've watched it a million times and it's still funny every time. It's definitely not a movie steeped in a complex storyline, but if you're looking for something light and funny, I don't know how this movie can go wrong.(9/10)

It's so popular not to like Eddie Murphy anymore. But, I have to say that this movie was pretty good. It was not a block buster, and I haven't a clue as to why it was called "I Spy", but I enjoyed the movie. It had some comedic moments, and Owen Wilson's pairing with Eddie Murphy worked well-enough.

When some friends of mine took me to this movie, I thought "how boring!". Was I ever wrong! I don't know if I've ever laughed at a movie so hard in my life! The plot was average, but the characters were great. A great movie to de-stress with!
